node.title: Court hears of strangulation injuries at sentencing of campground abductor
node.alt: A man with a short greying beard stares straight ahead
node.description: The defence for a man jailed overÂ abducting a five-year-old girl from a campground in Tasmania tells a court he has had to "deal with emotive media coverage" while in prison.
node.content:
["A Tasmanian man has been sentenced to six years in prison for abducting a five-year-old girl from a campground in the state's north-west earlier this year.", "Cecil Maurice Mabb, 42 of Rosebery, pleaded guilty to assaulting and abducting the girl from the Montagu campground, near Smithton, in January.\u00a0", "The girl was returned to her family within an hour, but Mabb fled the scene, prompting an extensive police search using drones, the rescue helicopter\u00a0and Parks and Wildlife rangers on foot.", "Mabb also pleaded guilty to assaulting one of the Parks and Wildlife rangers who found him during the search.\u00a0", "The Supreme Court in Launceston\u00a0heard the girl and a four-year-old boy from another family were riding their bikes from the campsite towards a boat ramp.", "And that Mabb had parked his vehicle in bushland near the campground before he grabbed the girl by her legs and threw her into his car as she screamed.", "In sentencing submissions, Justice Robert Pearce told the court the child said \"she had been choked\" and that there was bleeding into the whites of both eyes, along with redness and bruising on her neck.\u00a0", "Justice Pearce said choking carries a high risk of death or brain injury.\u00a0", "", "
The incident in Tasmania's north west sparked\u00a0an extensive manhunt.(Supplied: Tasmania Police)
", "A fellow camper found the girl on the beach alone, \"dazed and in shock\" about 1\u00a0kilometre from the family's campsite, the court heard.", "Doctors found she had injuries consistent with strangulation, as well as blunt force trauma to her head and scratches and grazes to much of her body, the court heard.", "Justice Pearce said there was no evidence the child had been sexually assaulted but said it cannot be excluded as a potential motivating factor.\u00a0", "He told the Supreme Court in Launceston that the effects on the girl may be \"lifelong\" and she \"continues to suffer from nightmares.\"\u00a0", "
History of child sex abuse
", "Justice Pearce told the court Mabb had a troubled upbringing, saying his mother was from the Stolen Generation and she had become an alcoholic due to the trauma of this.\u00a0", "Between 1995 and 2003, Mabb committed several sexual offences against children and was later imprisoned for these acts.\u00a0", "The court heard that on his release, Mabb commenced a new life with his wife and started a family.", "Justice Pearce said when this relationship broke down in 2019, Mabb \"began to heavily abuse alcohol and prescription drugs\" and became \"estranged from his children.\"\u00a0", "
'Wanting a cuddle'\u00a0
", "Defence lawyer Hannah Phillips said she read a victim impact statement to Mabb today and he found it \"horrific\"\u00a0and said he has \"ongoing remorse\" for his actions.\u00a0", "While in maximum security at Risdon Prison, Mabb told prison staff his motivation for the abduction was to eat her.", "But psychiatric reports written about Mabb found there was no evidence to support \"cannibalistic intent\" and that he later claimed he just \"wanted a hug\" after struggling with the breakdown of his family.\u00a0", "The defence said Mabb has also had to \"deal with emotive media coverage\" after a newspaper circulated the prison with the front page reading \"campsite cannibal\".", "Justice Pearce agreed that the psychiatric reports found \"no evidence to suggest cannibal intent\" and the judge found \"it was nothing but a bizarre attempt to get treatment in prison.\"\u00a0", "", "
The child was missing from the campground for about an hour, the court heard.(ABC News)
", "The court heard from prosecutor Katie Edwards who said the parents of the girl had told her the trauma to their child is ongoing.\u00a0", "Ms Edwards said psychiatric reports about Mabb \"can't state that there was sexual motivation\" but it \"can't be ruled out completely\".", "In regards to the \"motivation of wanting a cuddle\", she said, \"the use of strangulation meant the motivation must have gone further than that\".", "In her submission, Ms Edwards said \"protection of the community is a significant factor\" and \"the crime in itself requires a substantial period of imprisonment\".", "Mabb will be eligible for parole after serving four\u00a0years of his sentence, backdated to November 25th, 2021.\u00a0"]
